intro: Aganosma gracilis, commonly known as the slender aganosma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, glossy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
